I don't see why the current rain method is a problem.  The current Minecraft clouds would be either stratus or stratocumulus, which are both low in the sky and flat in shape.  They both can rain, but they aren't the source of significant rain because they are so thin.  In Minecraft, rain comes from a higher cloud layer that only forms when it starts raining.

https://scied.ucar.edu/webweather/clouds/cloud-types

I really don't like the idea of it raining in patches as small as 10x10 in Minecraft.  IRL you really only experience how patchy rain can be when you drive at high speeds and can drive out from under the clouds that are raining.  To a lesser extent, you can notice that it is raining off in the distance if you are under the right circumstances, but you have to have the right kind of landscape to be able to see that far.  In comparison, you really can't see all that far in Minecraft.  Even if you have a 15 chunk render distance, that's only 240 meters.  That's not even a kilometer!  Most of the time in real life rain it seems to be raining for as far as you can see, and it often is covering quite a large area.  Because of this, it makes sense to me that Minecraft just simplifies the whole thing by making it so it rains in the whole world at once, at least where it rains.

This would be better if, say:
-The rain clouds were at 20 by 20 blocks up to 100 by 100 blocks and the thunderstorms were 100 by 500 blocks or something like that.

The clouds should really be updated, but not quite like this. I think the clouds should be on multiple levels for one. It's really off putting that only two whole y coordinates of over 200 blocks are clouds. They should be more layered, and more numerous depending on the weather. It always bothered me that the weather would just do what ever it wants, seemingly with no reason. The game really needs a more intuitive weather system, and more types of weather too. Here are a few of my ideas:

Clouds have a spawning system that determines the weather. When clouds cluster enough, it rains. When they cluster too lightly for it to rain, it's overcast, which makes the overworld dimmer, and makes it harder to tell the time.

Wind would be an awesome addition. Nothing too big, I don't want tornados. But a wind speed system would be amazing. At lower intensities it would make great ambient sound, and at higher ones, it would make for a nice added challenge. Higher altitudes would very windy a lot as well.

Storms should be heavily improved. Lightning storms are traditionally scary, just like the dark. But unlike the dark, there's no special reason to fear a storm in Minecraft. They just allow mobs to spawn, makes cool atmosphere and very rarely strikes certain mobs with lightning. Storms should get a special mob, or allow phantoms to spawn regardless of sleep. They should be very windy, as too make it harder to fight off mobs. And should make choppy waters, as to disorient and inconvenience the player. Storms need to be feared!!

Personally I favor WeighedSpider97's idea. It shouldn't be too difficult to pull of and it would make the weather systems of MC magnitudes better.

Also, for those of us who lag a lot while flying in the rain with our elytra, this would open the option for flying above the clouds.

I have an idea for this update you could add a new peaceful difficulty where you lose hunger like in easy or hard difficulty ‚ÄúI know you can turn off hostile mobs but in bedrock it removes all friendly mobs as well‚Äù

A cool new mob would be something that stalks you, just as a suggestion. Anyways, I support the chat report system. The only fears I have is that somebody can possibly force you to type something; and then get you perma-banned. The new update coming is great. The new mace adds a unique and actually useful weapon to a structure, and therefore encourages exploration and better game progression; the number one problem with Survival. Also, it would be useful to not allow you to get mending from trades at all, in hard mode, to better moderate the game‚Äôs ‚Äúvillager exploits‚Äù, and progression. Also, there should be an effort made to help players understand redstone organically, to actually make automation fun, and not reliant on outside forces. Which just means players copy down whatever they see, and Al of the fun and rewarding stuff is only experienced by the content creators. The ‚Äúpotion of bad omen‚Äù effect, is a great and optional way to add better progression. I also feel as though combat still needs fixing and more variety. We need more variety and weapons and armor, and tools. I also feel as though, in Creative, building is too slow. It would be cool for a feature that allows you to hold down, and fill in a certain amount of blocks, or something. Since most players don‚Äôt understand commands. This would make building more fun, and far less tedious. Also, I feel as though the community-aspect of the game is severely limited in the Bedrock form.

Ok, I'm not sure if this feedback thing is for bedrock or java, but this should really come to both. I think you should be able to make compound materials in Minecraft, especially for tools. Say you used one gold and two iron to make a pickaxe. The pickaxe would be as strong as 2/3 iron and 1/3 gold and it would mine as fast as the faster material (I don't know which is faster). It would also provide a cool way to make more customisable tools and swords. You could have a mean looking netherite sword, surrounded with gold nuggets to make it have gold flecks on it, or a diamond sword with a hilt of blaze rods or something. Oh and same concept for armour. A helmet with a flower on the ear part, a gold helmet with emeralds and lapis encrusted in to look like a crown. There are so many possibilities, it's insane.

This sounds like a good idea, but I feel like if it's done like that, then the cost of the ingrediants and any level cost as well should increase with the amount of enchantment points. So while it is more efficient as you could keep the enchantments it should be a slightly more expensive alternative.

Hello, this appears to be a non-English post. Below you will find a transcription of the topic being discussed.  

 

Title: ‚ÄúImmediate Crafting Button for Mobile Devices‚Äù  

 

Text: ‚ÄúWe all know how heavy it is to have to craft large amounts of materials for example, if you need to make your house and pick up many logs it will get very heavy because you will have to craft 4 in 4 now, what I hope is that and I feel that it can help is to put a button on the crafting table interface and in the inventory interface , this button will do the function of sending all the items that can be made with that material, that is if you have 64 wooden logs and with the Instant Crafting button will send all the planks that can be made to your inventory You do not necessarily have to be a button, there can be another alternative for example to keep pressed the item you want to craft , wait for a green bar to fill up and when dragging it to inventory will appear all items that can be crafted This function can be very useful on mobiles and would replace the Shift + Right Click function in java‚Äù 

- Translated by Admin

I concur. especially on changing how horseback riding works. They should work like boats. riding them into combat is annoying as it is now.
I voted on this because there is a lot of supporting details to this idea. It makes sense and it would most definitely get a good amount of votes for this idea.
Another weapon horsemen would use would be lances. It could be a powerful frontal, single targeted attack weapon for horsemen.

Horses are mobs that were amazing when first added, but have lost their luster with the addition of the elytra, the best free-form transportation. Horses need a new niche, namely combat.
Controls: Horses will have the same controls as boats, you can move your head freely. Shift+Space will allow you to jump to a maximum of 3 blocks in the air. Shields are disabled on horses, however. An alternative might be to allow legitimate weapon dual wielding.
Additions: Horses now have more slots. You can add a lead, allowing you to lead a llama caravan, or other horses. Horses can also have a Ravager Horn: https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360043135032-Ravager-Horns : these allow the horse to break foliage.
Combat: Horses damage mobs when they run them over. Some horses do more damage than others and the quality is hereditary. While on a horse, all attacks are criticals, but the attack timer requires 1.5 to attack. (As opposed to 1-attack, 2-critical).
Zombie horses: Horses will now be pursued by zombies with the ability to pick up items. Horses will attempt to escape these zombies, but if caught and killed, they will become zombie horses. Which will be mounted by zombies. Unmounted zombie horses are passive, but once mounted by a zombie, a zombie horse will remain hostile.
Sorry I posted an essay- I typed up my own suggestion before seeing yours. I know mine will be removed, but I have a lot of suggestions. :p

No problem! The more feedback and activity that happens here, the better. Another thing I would love to see changed (that I forgot to mention in the introduction) is how the player sits on the horse - I think it'd be much more natural-looking with the legs spread out and at the horse's sides, like an actual rider might sit.

My suggestion is that by holding ctrl while riding in somewhat straight line would make you charge your enemies knocking them back while dealing a fair amount of damage, would be even greater with lances or spears.
It would be awesome if all of these changes came together in some kind of Horse Update! Lances would be awesome with revamped horses.

Another suggestion would be to add a bonus reach when riding horses. This idea works perfectly with the upcoming combat snapshots!

In addition it should be noted that sweeping edge should also be adjusted while riding a horse as It currently damages your mount.

My only worry would be that adding a horse trample function could give way to possible damage exploits, but if implemented only when the horse jumps, for example, I think it could be a really great idea!

You could also have horses deal kicking damage. If you just tapped Space (not enough to really jump) the horse would rear instead of jump and kick things in front of it. Of course, a horse can't rear constantly so you would still have to do some of the fighting yourself, the horse would just be able to help out a bit.
I feel that players on horses should have an extended reach, they should be able to hit mobs within 2x the normal distance.

I agree 100%. Here's a thought: What if horse armor was split into two pieces? You have the Saddle Armor, and the Bridle, both of which would come in all armor material variants, can be crafted, and have different levels of defense.

How about different effects for different types of weapons. Swords and Axes could have the sweeping effect you mentioned. Tridents, instead of throwing, could have a thrust effect like a jousting lance. Bows are a bit more challenging to think of ideas for though.

Please yes.  Once, I was sleeping outside when a creeper snuck up on me in bed, and I barely made it out in time.  (Actually, I was in my house; I was just being dumb and playing on hard without a roof or door to my house, since all my stuff was stored in a nearby stronghold.)

Partially agree. Something like this should be added in my opinion. However, for new players this could be ruining their first nights and making them not want to play anymore. I'd suggest this to be a hardcore feature only, and make it only zombies/skeletons/spiders who can wake you up. A creeper blowing you up will likely kill you in one hit and ending your world then and there.

Also, a "house" should be defined as follows:

1. The bed and the blocks directly aligned to it must not have acces to sky light or they have to be a wall.

2. There must be a 2-block space above the bed and 2 blocks next to the bed.

3. There must be a door.

This should create a minimal hut of a 2x2 inside area with a ceiling that is 3 blocks high.

 

Also, I still always sleep with a sword in my hand, something I taught muself when whis was a feature XD.
Like but the requirements for a house should only be this: 1.a bed 2.4 or more walls 3. a roof 4. a closed door.

Maybe we could make this a hard mode exclusive feature. I feel that it would be nice to see more difficulty tweaks between hard and normal modes that have greater impact than just "more damage and health"

Problem: How would a shelter/home be defined?

Answer:

a) this could be an exclusive feature for harder difficulties

b) this could be a tick-able option

c) perhaps this mob appearance would only occur if the player slept without a specific amount of lighting around them

d) perhaps having a certain amount of blocks around the player is what would define safety or danger for such an event
I disagree with that feature, because it is quiet annoying

I think a "house" should be defined as any place where a zombie, creeper, or skeleton couldn't pathfind to you. So you're encouraged to build a shelter, but not restricted by light levels, needing a roof, etc.

I would make it combinable with looting, but not with mending, and would it have reduced durability as well (xp *2 -> dura = 75%. xp*4 -> dura = 50%). This would be a treasured "mob farm grinding" item.

And this stacked with mending would be too OP. So it should not be stackable with mending, but yield a significant exp. boost. Like at level 1, xp*2, level 2 xp*3, level 3 xp*4. It should also be able to stack with looting, since this would go hand in hand.

I've been having the same idea for a while, it forces the player to think about the armor/weapons they use instead of going straight for diamond all the time. However, I'd also like to add a couple ideas of my own:

  • Gold should be really heavy despite its overall mediocrity, however, this is compensated for with an XP boost provided by equipping gold items.
  • A simple new tier should be added which is only slightly above leather called "hardened leather" and only applies to armor.
  • The ability to combine armor components. Say, the ability to make a chestplate that is part leather and part iron, or part iron and part gold (to gain a slight XP boost), with the properties of both materials combining.
